intro: Aulacocalyx laxiflora, commonly known as the laxiflorous hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are ovate and hairy, while the stems are woody and branching.
